text: Purines include two of the bases in DNA and RNA. A purine is a heterocyclic aromatic organic compound. It is a pyrimidine ring fused to an imidazole ring. Purines are the most widely occurring nitrogen-containing heterocycles in nature.Rosemeyer H. 2004. Chemistry & biodiversity. 1, 361. Purines and pyrimidines are the two groups of nitrogenous bases, and the two groups of nucleotide bases. == Purines == *Adenine *Guanine *Hypoxanthine *Xanthine == References == Category:Organonitrogen compounds
title: Purine
